metadata.description: Spec for a minimal hello-world Python script at repo root with deterministic output and POSIX executability.
metadata.mission: Deliver a minimal Python hello-world script at the repo root with a standard entry point, POSIX executable support, and deterministic output.
metadata.objectives:
- Deliver a hello-world Python script with deterministic output.
- Ensure POSIX direct execution support while keeping python3 as the portable path.
- Document minimum Python version and platform support in spec metadata.
assumptions: Repository allows adding hello.py at the repo root.
POSIX execution (chmod +x, ./hello.py) is acceptable for local development; portable path remains python3 hello.py.
Windows support is via python3 hello.py; direct execution (./hello.py) is POSIX-only.
Executable bit must be preserved in git (file mode 100755) for hello.py on POSIX systems.
No automated tests will be added; verification is manual.

metadata.description: Create the hello.py entry point with standard Python structure and POSIX executable support.
Add hello.py at repo root with a module docstring, main() function, and __main__ guard that prints the required greeting to stdout.
acceptance_criteria: Module docstring is exactly "Hello world sample."
main() prints exactly "Hello, world!" to stdout with a trailing newline

task-1-2.title: Add Python 3 shebang and executable bit

metadata.description: Add a Python 3 shebang line and mark the script executable on POSIX systems. Ensure the executable bit is preserved in git (mode 100755).
acceptance_criteria: hello.py is marked executable on POSIX (chmod +x hello.py)
Git file mode for hello.py is 100755 on POSIX systems

metadata.description: Run the script via python3 and, on POSIX, direct execution to confirm stdout and exit status.
acceptance_criteria: python3 hello.py exits 0 and prints exactly "Hello, world!" to stdout with a trailing newline
./hello.py exits 0 and prints exactly "Hello, world!" to stdout with a trailing newline on POSIX systems
Executable bit is preserved in git (mode 100755) on POSIX systems
